intro: Heliophila latisiliqua var. macrostylis, commonly known as the broad-styled heliophila, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are small and white, often arranged in flat-topped clusters, and it produces small, round fruits. This variety is noted for its robust growth and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
